Package clishell.ex

  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CliCommandResolutionException  
    CliException
    CliException is the most generalized form of application exceptions generated by the CLI code; pretty much all of the CLI exceptions should derive from this class, and it is advised not to throw instances of this class directly in order to facilitate caller-level discernment of various classes of exceptions and error conditions.
    CliExceptionCollection
    CliExceptionCollection is a specialization of a CliException that also maintains a collection of "incidental exceptions" - exceptions that were thrown secondary to the initial exception that caused an instance of this class to be generated.
    CliInvalidPluginMetadataException
    Signals the encounter of invalid metadata in a plugin module
    CliInvariantViolationException
    Runtime (unchecked) CLI exception, thrown when a program "invariant" is violated, usually indicating a programming or logic error.
    CliPluginMethodException
    Exception thrown from a CLI Plugin Method.
    CliRejectedInputException
    Signals the rejection of user input (i.e., CLI commands, plugin metadata, etc.) by any part of the CLI.
    CliRunnerException
    Distinguished from CliException primarily due to being connected foremost to the CliRunner program.
